fix an Accelerometer second to microsecond convertion error in Android platform
data.body:
fix an Accelerometer second to microsecond convertion error in Android platform
1 second = 1000000 microsecond

data.title: fixed #17494: Adds setTimeout to wrap NSTimer since ‘timerWithTimeInterval:repeats:block’ is only available from iOS 10, macOS 10.12.
Support for the tvOS micro gamepad as a CCController
data.body: Adds support for the tvOS [microGamepad](https://developer.apple.com/reference/gamecontroller/gcmicrogamepad). This allows some games that already support CCController to be playable on tvOS (limited to the dpad and A/X buttons).

1 second = 1000000 microsecond

data.title: Cocos documentation should be corrected after #17424
data.body:
Hi, 

Win10/Cocos2d-x 3.14.1

Was just following the cocos documentation on http://cocos2d-x.org/docs/static-pages/installation.html in order to try out Android Studio Setup. I've downloaded the latest/greatest(?) Android Studio and related sdk, ndk, ant (added to path, etc) When following the steps I had first to complete the prerequisite: http://cocos2d-x.org/docs/installation/Android-terminal/index.html

Problems started at:  
python android-build.py -p 21 cpp-tests

The reason was https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/issues/17424

I've patched the scripts natural-law fixed and tried again only to get the message that the command line build is not supported with Android SDK Tools 25.3.x.

I guess this obsoletes the all the instruction on:
http://cocos2d-x.org/docs/installation/Android-terminal/index.html


Can you please fix the documentations? Do we even need command line build for android?

I don't know if this is related to the above (I guess it is since I could not complete the step): 
I then skipped this step opened Android Studio and opened cpp-tests. After some updating, rebuilding, updating again, rebuilding... the project was built without errors, but when I start it (either on device or simulator) I get:

```
03-15 14:58:39.216 2611-2611/org.cocos2dx.cpp_tests E/AndroidRuntime: FATAL EXCEPTION: main
                                                                      Process: org.cocos2dx.cpp_tests, PID: 2611
                                                                      java.lang.UnsatisfiedLinkError: dalvik.system.PathClassLoader[DexPathList[[zip file "/data/app/org.cocos2dx.cpp_tests-1/base.apk", zip file "/data/app/org.cocos2dx.cpp_tests-1/split_lib_dependencies_apk.apk", zip file "/data/app/org.cocos2dx.cpp_tests-1/split_lib_slice_0_apk.apk", zip file "/data/app/org.cocos2dx.cpp_tests-1/split_lib_slice_1_apk.apk", zip file "/data/app/org.cocos2dx.cpp_tests-1/split_lib_slice_2_apk.apk", zip file "/data/app/org.cocos2dx.cpp_tests-1/split_lib_slice_3_apk.apk", zip file "/data/app/org.cocos2dx.cpp_tests-1/split_lib_slice_4_apk.apk", zip file "/data/app/org.cocos2dx.cpp_tests-1/split_lib_slice_5_apk.apk", zip file "/data/app/org.cocos2dx.cpp_tests-1/split_lib_slice_6_apk.apk", zip file "/data/app/org.cocos2dx.cpp_tests-1/split_lib_slice_7_apk.apk", zip file "/data/app/org.cocos2dx.cpp_tests-1/split_lib_slice_8_apk.apk", zip file "/data/app/org.cocos2dx.cpp_tests-1/split_lib_slice_9_apk.apk"],nativeLibraryDirectories=[/data/app/org.cocos2dx.cpp_tests-1/lib/x86, /system/lib, /vendor/lib]]] couldn't find "libcpp_tests.so"
                                                                          at java.lang.Runtime.loadLibrary0(Runtime.java:984)
                                                                          at java.lang.System.loadLibrary(System.java:1530)
                                                                          at org.cocos2dx.lib.Cocos2dxActivity.onLoadNativeLibraries(Cocos2dxActivity.java:248)
                                                                          at org.cocos2dx.lib.Cocos2dxActivity.onCreate(Cocos2dxActivity.java:264)
                                                                          at android.app.Activity.performCreate(Activity.java:6679)
                                                                          at android.app.Instrumentation.callActivityOnCreate(Instrumentation.java:1118)
                                                                          at android.app.ActivityThread.performLaunchActivity(ActivityThread.java:2618)
                                                                          at android.app.ActivityThread.handleLaunchActivity(ActivityThread.java:2726)
                                                                          at android.app.ActivityThread.-wrap12(ActivityThread.java)
                                                                          at android.app.ActivityThread$H.handleMessage(ActivityThread.java:1477)
                                                                          at android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage(Handler.java:102)
                                                                          at android.os.Looper.loop(Looper.java:154)
                                                                          at android.app.ActivityThread.main(ActivityThread.java:6119)
                                                                          at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Native Method)
                                                                          at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit$MethodAndArgsCaller.run(ZygoteInit.java:886)
                                                                          at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit.main(ZygoteInit.java:776)
```


One more thing... from the documentation it is not clear from where to get the sdk/ndk. The latest android studio downloads the sdk/ndk automatically from withing Tools/Android/sdkmanager. Are those ok, do I need other ones? 

It's my first attempt at running the android build so please excuse my ignorance.

data.title: Changing a test case header file forces a recompile of all tests
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: latest `v3` from this repo (8c542d711d1d341b59c4905827a2b7bde23da19b)
- developing environments
   - CMake: 3.7.2

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Compile the Cocos2D-x test suite.
2. Make a cosmetic change in any header file in the `tests/cpp-tests/Classes` directory.
3. Run `cmake --build` to recompile.

Expected behavior:

The test case is recompiled in a short time span.

Actual behavior:

Every test case within `tests/cpp-tests` is recompiled, which can take several minutes. Is there any reason it has to be this way?

data.title: Jsb improvements
VS and XCode project files have non-existent file references
data.body: Removed and renamed several files that do not exist or have been renamed, but the project files had never been updated.  This was causing an issue building with Visual Studio 2015/2017, with a "Project is out of date" warning every time the program is run from within the IDE.

data.title: Fixes cocos2d build for tvOS.
data.body:
Fixes errors when building target "libcocos2d tvOS" for iPhone Simulator.

There are still errors when building for a tvOS device - these are caused by the external libs. Building for a device requires tvOS libs but currently only iOS libs are prebuilt. These libs are already set up on 3rd-party-libs-src and should be added to cocos2d-x-3rd-party-libs-bin.

data.title: Win32 performance is bad.
data.body: - cocos2d-x version:14.1 - devices test on:Win32 - developing environments - VS version: vs community 2015 14.0.25431.01 Steps to Reproduce: print the fps. if (dt>0.0167f){ cclog("dt=%f",dt); } Our game is running with steady 0.0166667f on all devices ,but on win32 the game is lagging i tried to print the fps since i noticed that the update function is not steady like other platforms. if you can see the fps go up to 0.0200f. ![capture](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3635272/23903803/6d9cd47a-08ce-11e7-8530-6a3510012c2b.PNG) on the next image the game on mac is running without any issue and the fps perfect.

data.title: [ci skip] [win32] Updates lua template
data.body: Lua template depends on simulator which is a static library reference curl, therefore lua project created by template needs to link with `libcurl.lib`

data.title: fixed #17395: OpenAL A003 error if doing AL invocation before alcMakeContextCurrent(s_ALContext);
data.body: Pause director if Audio Session is still in interrupted state, resume director in interrupted ended.

data.title: [win32] Updates template project configuration files.
